titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Gerard Malanga Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 04:18

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection contains materials documenting the artistic, professional, and personal activities of Gerard Malanga. Materials include correspondence, research and subject files, drafts and printed versions of writings, photographic materials, audiovisual materials, printed materials, and artwork. There is correspondence with publishers and editors, galleries and cultural organizations, writers, friends, and family. The research files and writings document work by Malanga and others. There are drafts, autograph manuscript and typescript, of a great many individual poems by Malanga and more extensive, though scattered files for collections of poems and other book-length projects, such as Ten Years After (1977), This Will Kill That (1983), Mythologies of the Heart (1996), and Scopophilia (1985). Materials can also be found for projects that relate to Malanga's work as a photograph archivist for the New York City Parks Department, including books on Robert Moses and public swimming facilities in the city. Photographic materials include negatives, contact sheets, and prints, and feature portraits of writers and artists, chiefly American poets, dating from the late 1960s and early 1970s. Audiovisual materials include audiocassettes, reel-to-reel sound recordings, and optical media, including readings and performances by Malanga and others. Printed materials include posters, issues of magazines, clippings, and ephemera.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 113-117, 119, and 154-155 (Audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Photo Anonyme Ltd. on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund and gift of Asako Kitaori and Gerard Malanga, 2006-2009.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into six groupings: I. September 2006 Acquisition. II. September 2006 Addition. III. November 2007 Acquisition. IV. November 2007 Addition. V. July 2008 Acquisition. VI. September 2009 Acquisition.

bioghist.head: Gerard Malanga (1943-)
bioghist.p: Gerard Malanga is an American poet, photographer, and filmmaker. He was born in New York in 1943 and studied at the School of Industrial Art and Wagner College. He was Andy Warhol's chief assistant from 1963 to 1970 and, in addition to starring in many of Warhol's early films, he also made and starred in films of his own. His books of poetry include This Will Kill That (1978) and Mythologies of the Heart (1996), and his books of photography include Good Girls (1994) and Resistance to Memory (1998). He also edited a book on voyeurism in photography entitled Scopophilia: The Love of Looking (1985). Malanga lives and works in New York.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Gerard Malanga Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.
Former call numbers: Uncat MSS 898, Uncat MSS 960, Uncat MSS 990, Uncat MSS 994, Uncat MSS 1032, and Uncat MSS 1225.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains materials documenting the artistic, professional, and personal activities of Gerard Malanga. Materials include correspondence, research and subject files, drafts and printed versions of writings, photographic materials, audiovisual materials, printed materials, and artwork. There is correspondence with publishers and editors, galleries and cultural organizations, writers, friends, and family. The research files and writings document work by Malanga and others. There are drafts, autograph manuscript and typescript, of a great many individual poems by Malanga and more extensive, though scattered files for collections of poems and other book-length projects, such as Ten Years After (1977), This Will Kill That (1983), Mythologies of the Heart (1996), and Scopophilia (1985). Materials can also be found for projects that relate to Malanga's work as a photo archivist for the New York City Parks Department, including books on Robert Moses and public swimming facilities in the city. Photographic materials include negatives, contact sheets, and prints, and feature portraits of writers and artists, chiefly American poets, dating from the late 1960s and early 1970s. Audiovisual materials include audiocassettes, reel-to-reel sound recordings, and optical media, including readings and performances by Malanga and others. Printed materials include posters, issues of magazines, clippings, and ephemera.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Gerard Malanga Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Photo Anonyme Ltd. on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The first September 2006 Acquisition contains material documenting the artistic, professional, and personal activities of Gerard Malanga. Materials include correspondence, research and subject files, drafts and printed versions of writings, photographs, artwork, audiovisual materials, and printed materials, including posters, issues of magazines, clippings, and ephemera.
In the contents list below, folder titles transcribed from those provided by the creator or previous custodian are indicated by quotations marks.
Former call number: Uncat MSS 898.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 113-114 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material has been left in the order in which it was received by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A handwritten note included with the audiocassette states 'Poem cut off on B side'. It reads: The savage is reborn within himself, within the civilized he needs anarchy in projected order. He needs his life back. He's been denied, hidden molded kicked goaded stripped driven and he's back here now always cannot be killed but he can kill wants blood yours.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into six subseries: I. Correspondence. II. Research for Scopophilia . III. Writings, Research, and Professional Files. IV. Printed Material. V. Family Papers. VI. Artwork.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Boxes 154-155 (Audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

The September 2009 Acquisition contains professional and personal files, including correspondence, research material relating to Scopophilia and other projects, drafts of writings, printed material, and family papers.
Former call number: Uncat MSS 1225.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Photo Anonyme Ltd. on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2009.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains material relating to Malanga's research for the book he edited on voyeurism in photography, Scopophilia: The Love of Looking (1985). Material includes clippings and tearsheets from various sources, as well as correspondence, video and audio recordings, and photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a VHS called "Mellow Mail: Lingerie Video Volume 3", a deck of sealed erotic playing cards containing vintage pictures, and clippings and pamphlets regarding nudity and erotica.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of material relating to Gerard Malanga's mother, Emma (ne Lovetree) Malanga. Included are correspondence, audio recordings, and legal and financial documents relating to a fraud committed against her, as well as materials documenting her funeral arrangements, death, and memorial service.
